DataElement.preferredName: Rectal Carcinoma Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Dimension Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the longest dimensione, in cm, of a malignant tumor arising from the epithelium of the rectal mucosa in a particular direction, especially length or width or height following administration of neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Rectal Carcinoma Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the the magnitude of a malignant tumor arising from the epithelium of the rectal mucosa in a particular direction, especially length or width or height following administration of neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor arising from the epithelium of the rectal mucosa.  Most rectal carcinomas are adenocarcinomas; squamous cell carcinomas of the rectum are also seen.  Prognosis depends on tumor stage (depth of wall invasion, lymph node involvement, presence of distal metastases). -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the rectum. The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a linear measurement (in cm) of a tumor's dimension or diameter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: If Yes, Longest dimension of Invasive Carcinoma

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
